description: In Nimikoro people rely more on agriculture during the rainy season. They do not rely at all on debt or sales and trades. In Sandor, mining represents a higher part of the incomes during rainy season.
ytitle: Pourcentage of income from mining in the rainy season
Percentage use of income for health over the year

description: Once again we can see that in Nimikoro there is no problems of debts. We see also that health seems more of a problem in Kamara and Nimiyama
ytitle: Percentage use of income for debt over the year

description: In Kamara people seem a little bit more vulnerable
almost all of those who get income form animal breeding during the dry season have seen their food situation worsenned because of COVID19
ytitle: Pourcentage of income coming from animal breeding in rainy season

description: Those living pricipaly from agriculture and mining consider themselves globaly poorer than the rest of the community
This is confirmed if we look at the FCS score
People with the lowest FCS scores seem to have more expenses related to health and family obligations
People who joined the gemfair program seems to work a little more than before (specialy those who joined more recently)
They also seem to be a little whealthier than before
Large households were more affected by the COVID crisis
people earning money from a second job during rainy season seem less affected
When the mine site is prefinanced, people have less unstable incomes
xtitle: Is your mine site prefinanced or supported?

description: The richer people consider themselves the more stable is their income
Those with a second job have a lower FCS score

In Sandor people seem to pay more for their gang
Workers in gemfair seems to have had more decrease in their daily wages
